settings.title: Best Electrolytes for Fasting
settings.text:
Support healthy, prolonged fasts with the latest innovation in electrolyte supplementation.

Electrolytes are crucial to fasting, yet most electrolyte options actually break your fast.

Electrify your fasting journey with Buoy's unflavored and unsweetened hydration drops perfectly formulated for Intermittent Fasting (IF), Keto and prolonged fasts.
settings.text_bottom:
Why Electrolytes Matter

How To Prep For Your Fast

What Ingredients To Avoid

Fasting Benefits

Our Electrolyte Solution

Plus, a sneak peek of our favorite electrolyte to use for any fast!

settings.title: ü§í Avoid The "Keto Flu"
settings.text:
People starting fasts can feel like they have the flu, even when they don‚Äôt--irritable mornings, dizziness, low energy and insomnia.

In your new metabolic state, your body burns fatty acids instead of glucose for energy. Your insulin levels may drop, cueing your kidneys to release sodium from your body.

That's why low glycogen and insulin levels have similar symptoms as dehydration--you‚Äôre peeing out all those energy bunny electrolytes.

Maintain a steady intake of key electrolytes and minerals to help fight the Keto Flu.

settings.title: üîã Stable Energy Levels
settings.text:
Perhaps the most common issue with fasting is low energy levels throughout the day.

Without food and most beverages as an option to rehydrate, you're often left feeling depleted.

Support all day energy by getting in fasting-friendly electrolytes!

settings.title: üß† Support Cognitive Function
settings.text:
Fasting can often induce brain fog and poor concentration due to electrolyte imabalnces.

Improve mental clarity and focus with a steady supply of electrolytes during your fasting journey with proper, balanced hydration levels.

settings.title: üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Enhance Your Exercise
settings.text:
Electrolyte supplementation becomes an absolute necessity if you're going to be exercising while fasting.

Losing just 2% of fluids and key electrolytes can significantly impair physical performance. When you exercise, you lose 6 to 10%.

Infusing your water with these essential minerals will optimize your exercise and movement by replenishing and restoring already lower levels of electrolytes for longer, more sustainable workouts.

settings.title: ü¶µPrevent Muscle Cramps
settings.text:
Electrolytes like sodium are crucial to every cell and system to muscle contractions, transport nutrients and send signals in your nervous system.

Without enough of them, you'll be prone to cramping, which can be some of the more uncomfortable experiences during a fast.

Say goodbye to cramps for good with a balanced, sugar-free electrolyte and mineral infused supply of water.

settings.title: ‚öñÔ∏è Balanced Blood Sugar
settings.text:
While fasting, you're bound to feel hungry.

With a supply of electrolytes and trace minerals like chromium that support satiety and insulin sensitivity, you'll have fewer cravings to make for a more comfortable journey.

settings.title: ‚ö°Ô∏è Maintain Hydration
settings.text: Our bodies don‚Äôt store electrolytes for long, so you‚Äôll deplete the existing ones stored in your body‚Äôs tissues pretty quickly where you‚Äôll start to feel the negative impacts of electrolyte deficiencies: fatigue, headaches, grogginess, muscle cramps, nausea and a decline in performance.

settings.title: Why electrolytes matter during fasting
settings.text_bottom:
When fasting, your body changes metabolic states from burning carbohydrates for energy to a ketogenic state where you burn fat‚Äîhence the popular diet named ‚ÄúKeto‚Äù.

In this new fasting state, you're more easily susceptible to electrolyte imbalances that can undermine your fast and resemble flu-like symptoms.

settings.title: Heart Health
settings.subtitle: LOWER LDL & TOTAL CHOLESTEROL
settings.text: A recent study linked alternate day fasting to lower levels of key heart health markers like triglycerides, total cholesterol and the "bad" LDL cholesterol.

settings.title: Cognitive Protection
settings.subtitle: COGNITION BOOSTER
settings.text:
While animals have only been studied thus far for links to brain health, the results have been overwhelmingly positive for cognitive performance.

Fasting can reduce inflammation which may lead to neurodegenerative disorders like Alzheimer‚Äôs disease and Parkinson‚Äôs, it may also enhance cognitive function by increasing the generation of nerve cells in the brain.

settings.title: Weight Loss
settings.subtitle: METABOLISM BOOSTER
settings.text:
Not only does fasting limit your total calories consumed, but it also revs your metabolism.

Studies link consistent use of Intermittent Fasting to effective reductions in weight by many dieters.

settings.title: Blood Sugar Control
settings.subtitle: REDUCED INSULIN RESISTANCE
settings.text: Even doing intermittent fasting just three times a week can help your body transport glucose from your blood to your cells more efficiently, lowering your risk of Type 2 Diabetes.

settings.title: Soothe Inflammation
settings.subtitle: REDUCED LEVELS OF C-REACTIVE PROTEIN
settings.text: A 2022 study showed that moderate intermittent fasting practices reduced key markers of inflammation like lower levels of C-reactive proteins.

settings.title: Health Benefits of Fasting
settings.text: There's some science behind the hype‚Äîeven intermittent fasting is linked to lasting health benefits from brain health to weight loss.

settings.title:
Buoy's Solution:
The Perfect Electrolyte Balance for Fasting
settings.text:
Buoy's purposefully unflavored and unsweetened line of electrolyte drops infuse any beverage with fast-acting hydration that works at the cellular level. Sourced from nature's most powerful ingredients.

settings.suptitle: Even "Popular" Zero-Sugar Electrolyte Powders May Break Your Fast
settings.suptext:
One of the reasons Buoy is so effective is because of it's purposefully unflavored and unsweetened, naturally-soruced and unprocessed electrolyte and mineral profile.

Even without sugar, sweeteners and "natural" flavors may spike blood sugar and spark metabolic reactions in your body that can undermine, or even break, a fast.

settings.title: Dissolves Instantly & Evenly In Any Beverage
How To Use Buoy's Electrolytes During Fasting
settings.description:
Essential electrolytes, 87 ionic trace minerals and vitamins delivered in their most bioavailable form factor for fast-acting hydration.

‚Äî One Serving = One Short Squeeze

settings.button_label: Fast Better With Buoy's Electrolyte Drops

settings.title: Ocean Electrolytes
settings.text:
Get the highest quality sodium, chloride, potassium and magnesium earth has to offer.

‚öñÔ∏è Naturally-Balanced
üß™ Third Party Tested
üåä Hand Harvested

settings.title: 87+ Ionic Trace Minerals
settings.text: Infuse your fast with hard-to-find but essential trace minerals like Boron, Selenium, Silica, Manganese and more to support every cell and system.

settings.title: Naturally-Balanced Ratios
settings.text:
Sodium, potassium, chloride and magnesium are the essential electrolytes needed for optimal hydration.

Getting all of these in their naturally occurring ratios‚Äîlike from harvested sea salt‚Äîmakes for easy absorption as its the way we've hydrated for cenuries before modern society.

settings.title: Plant-Powered B Vitamins
settings.text:
Did you know some vitamins can help you hydrate better?

Buoy's curated blend of plant-powered B vitamins that support routine electrolyte function and help power your fast without breaking it!

settings.title: Electrify Your Fast With Nature's Original Mineral Boost
settings.subtext: Buoy's premium electrolytes and minerals tap into one of nature's most powerful ingredient sources: the deep ocean.

settings.title: Why Salt Source Matters
settings.text:
85% of an average American's sodium intake comes from nutrient sparse sources like the cheap and processed salts found in sports drinks and traditional electrolyte products.

‚ùå Sodium Bicarbonate
‚ùå Sodium Chloride
‚ùå Sodium Benzoate
‚ùå Pink Himalayan Salt (recently linked to heavy metals)
‚úÖ Real Sea Salt

settings.title: Modern Agricultural Practices
settings.text:
Even if you‚Äôre eating a balanced, organic diet when not fasting, you‚Äôre still likely deficient in electrolytes and minerals because of how we source our food and water.

Modern agricultural practices have stripped our soil, and therefore our food, our essential minerals and nutrients. Today, our food is exponentially less nutrient and mineral dense than it was even 50 years ago, making it hard to replenish these energizing minerals with diet alone.

settings.title: Commercial Water Processing
settings.text: Bottled water, even spring water, goes through production processes that strip beneficial micronutrients out. What‚Äôs left is a mineral content that‚Äôs just enough to market, but not enough to matter, especially when it comes to trace minerals.

settings.title: Electrolyte Rich Foods
settings.text:
Without food intake to provide electrolytes and minerals, you're left to supplement these essential nutrients elsewhere.

So, when you‚Äôre not fasting, stock up on these foods rich in electrolytes and minerals to support your fasting states.

‚úì Avocados
‚úì Bananas
‚úì Watermelon
‚úì Spinach
‚úì Lentils
‚úì Pickle Juice
‚úì Sunflower Seeds
‚úì Apricots

settings.title: Easily incorporate electrolytes into your routine
settings.subtext: Buoy turns any drink an electrolyte and multi-mineral beverage in one squeeze.

settings.title: Why are electrolytes essential for the body?
settings.answer: Electrolytes are vital nutrients that support whole-body health. From our mood to our muscles and ability to detox, electrolytes play a key role in over 300 enzymatic reactions in our body that benefit daily life.

settings.title: How does fasting impact electrolyte levels in the body?
settings.answer: While fasting, you're no longer getting electrolytes from food and beverages. Furthermore, with longer fasting windows, your body changes metabolic states from burning glucose for energy to fat. When this happens, your body cues your kidneys to dump excess fluids and sodium, meaning you'll be running through electrolytes faster than you would outside of fasting windows.

settings.title: Why is it crucial to maintain electrolyte balance during fasting?
settings.answer: Your body will run through any remaining electrolytes stored in tissues pretty quickly further depleting your body of optimal electrolyte levels required to maintain and perform basic bodily functions and daily tasks.

settings.title: How can I recognize symptoms of electrolyte imbalance during fasting?
settings.answer:
Some of the first signs of an electrolyte imbalance while fasting may be fatigue, dizziness, headaches, muscle cramps and other symptoms that are also associated with dehydration.

While some changes to how you feel are normal when fasting, supplementing electrolytes helps support longer, more comfortable fasts.

settings.title: Are there natural food sources that can replenish electrolytes during fasting?
settings.answer:
By definition, a fast is a period of time where you abstain from eating food.

While there are some studies that show minimal amounts of specific foods and beverages might not break a fast, there's more evidence to show that these portions do undermine the benefits.

Buoy delivers electrolytes and essential nutrition without the macro-nutritional profiles that induce metabolic state changes.

settings.title: How do Buoy's electrolyte products differ from regular sports drinks?
settings.answer:
Sports drinks are typically high in sugar, calories, carbohydrates and other additives that would instantly break a fast.

Buoy is made without sugar, sweeteners, flavors, calories, carbohydrates, additives or any ingredient that will break your fast. Our clean and pure ocean electrolytes and minerals dissolve instantly and evenly into water or any beverage to replenish, refuel and rehydrate.

settings.title: Can I use Buoy's electrolytes during intermittent fasting?
settings.answer:
Yes!

Buoy's electrolyte drops will support longer, more comfortable fasting windows during your intermittent fast by infusing your water with electrolytes and 87+ trace minerals every cell and system in your body crave.

settings.title: Are there any side effects of consuming electrolyte supplements while fasting?
settings.answer:
For the most part, electrolyte supplements will break your fast.

Even the zero-sugar electrolytes are filled with sweeteners, flavors or minimal calories that will undermine your fast.

Buoy is one of the only fasting-formulated electrolyte options that will fortify, not compromise, your fast.

settings.title: How often should I take Buoy's electrolytes during a fasting period?
settings.answer: While fasting, use up to 12 servings of Buoy per day, throughout the day. It's best to start in the morning and dose Buoy evenly throughout the day to keep optimal electrolyte and mineral levels stable for a comfortable fasting experience.

settings.title: Can I combine Buoy's electrolytes with other fasting supplements or vitamins?
settings.answer:
Yes!

Buoy stacks seamlessly with whatever supplements and vitamins you're using on your fasting journey.
